abstract: Citigroup, Bank of America and JPMorgan Chase plan to create a $75 billion to $100 billion fund to buy bonds and other debt at a time when many investors are avoiding them.
snippet: Citigroup, Bank of America and JPMorgan Chase plan to create a $75 billion to $100 billion fund to buy bonds and other debt at a time when many investors are avoiding them.
lead_paragraph: Three of the nation’s largest banks, working together at the behest of the Treasury Department, announced this morning that they were creating a large fund to serve as a buyer of bonds and other debt at a time when many investors are avoiding them.

headline.main: Banks to Start Fund to Protect Credit Market
headline.print_headline: Banks Start Fund to Protect Credit Market

abstract: Citigroup, Bank of America and JPMorgan Chase are  creating a fund to buy bonds and other debt at a time when many investors are avoiding them.
snippet: Citigroup, Bank of America and JPMorgan Chase are  creating a fund to buy bonds and other debt at a time when many investors are avoiding them.
lead_paragraph: Three of the nation’s largest banks, working together at the behest of the Treasury Department, confirmed today that they are creating a large fund to serve as a buyer of bonds and other debt at a time when many investors are avoiding them. But this morning’s official announcement was short on details, and analysts and investors appeared to be taking a wait-and-see approach on the prospects of the plan.

headline.main: Banks Create a Fund to Protect Credit Market
headline.print_headline: Banks Start Fund to Protect Credit Market

byline.original: By Vikas Bajaj and Michael M. Grynbaum

abstract: Citigroup, Bank of America and JPMorgan Chase, working together at the behest of the Treasury Department, announced Monday that they are creating a large fund to serve as a buyer of bonds and other debt at a time when many investors are avoiding them.
lead_paragraph: Citigroup, Bank of America and JPMorgan Chase, working together at the behest of the Treasury Department, announced Monday that they are creating a large fund to serve as a buyer of bonds and other debt at a time when many investors are avoiding them.

headline.main: Banks to Start Fund to Protect Credit Market
